DOC.brief_title: Evaluating Video Bystander Program First-Year College Students
DOC.detailed_description: Sexual violence , include sexual coercion assault , significant problem college campus due high prevalence adverse consequence . This research evaluate innovative video bystander program , potential implement broadly cost-effectively across college campus . We recruit first-year college student 4 college campus ( Southern Methodist University , Marquette University , William Paterson University , Stony Brook University ) . The video bystander program ( TakeCARE ) start narrator acknowledge various demand place student attempt balance adult responsibility social opportunity college , well importance keep safe engage social activity . The program describe likely people know may become victim sexual violence help `` take care friend '' help prevent victimization . TakeCARE include 3 video vignette demonstrate way student intervene see sexual coercion , relationship violence , situation might result harm . After baseline assessment , student randomly assign view one two video program : TakeCARE ( video bystander program ) control video program . A post-treatment assessment complete within week view video program , follow-up assessment complete 2 month 6 month baseline .
